pulse.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the regular beat that can be felt, for example at your wrist, as your heart pumps blood around your body
pulse.translation[0].definitions[0].note: take somebodyâ€™s pulse (=count the beats of their pulse, usually by feeling their wrist)
pulse.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: His breathing was shallow and his pulse was weak.
She felt his neck. There was no pulse.
Her pulse raced  (=beat very quickly) with excitement.
The doctor listened to his breathing and checked his pulse.
I held his wrist, trying to find a pulse.
If your pulse rate is between 90 and 100, it is likely that you are unfit.
pulse.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a strong regular beat in music
pulse.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: the distant pulse of a steel band
pulse.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: an amount of sound, light, or electricity that continues for a very short time
pulse.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the ideas, feelings, or opinions that are most important to a particular group of people or have the greatest influence on them at a particular time
pulse.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Clinton had an uncanny ability to sense the pulse of the nation.
pulse.translation[0].note_box[0].section: take somebody's pulse
Remember to take your pulse at intervals while you are exercising.
check/feel somebody's pulse
The nurse left the room after checking the girl's pulse.
feel for a pulse
I felt for a pulse, but I couldn't find one.
find a pulse
To her relief, she found a pulse.
somebody's pulse beats
His pulse began to beat with a fierce rhythm.
somebody's pulse races
His long fingers brushed hers, sending her pulse racing.
somebody's pulse quickens
He heard a footfall in the passage outside and felt his pulse quicken.
weak/faint
The boy's pulse was very weak.
He's breathing better. The pulse is stronger too.
rapid/fast
Symptoms include a rapid pulse and dry skin.
slow
Her pulse was slow but steady.
A normal pulse is between 70 and 90 beats a minute.
pulse + NOUN
pulse rate
The doctor checked my weight and pulse rate.
pulse beat
The rhythm was steady, as regular as a pulse beat.
pulse.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to move or flow with a steady quick beat or sound
pulse.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: She felt the blood pulsing through her veins.
Colored lights pulsed in time to the music.
pulse.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if a feeling or emotion pulses through someone, they feel it very strongly
pulse.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to push a button on a food processor to make the machine go on and off regularly, rather than work continuously
pulse.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Pulse several times until the mixture looks like oatmeal.
